title: [Large-Scale] UDL-Based Online Language Education Course for Cultivating Expert Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate+ language proficiency (reading, writing, listening, speaking) and basic online learning skills, with foundational grammar comprehension
context.additional_context: Asynchronous BYOD-based workplace education ensuring flexible learning schedules. Task design focuses on improving learners' writing proficiency and communication skills.

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more self-directed learning strategies based on UDL principles to improve language comprehension and expression skills.

Learners can achieve 80% or higher in expert learner competencies (self-assessment, metacognition, learning transfer) in the language domain, with a focus on vocabulary expansion and grammatical structure analysis.
Learners can design and execute personalized learning pathways using various digital tools, and perform language practice utilizing text generation and speech recognition technologies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
